p: C. elegans is a common nematode living in the soil. C. elegans can provide a useful toxicity test system that is best suitable for interrogating in vivo problems. C. elegans has been used in many biological researches, such as genomics, cell biology, neuroscience and aging. The C. elegans is characterized by short life cycle, compact genome, stereotypical development, ease of propagation and small size [ 14], which serves as a remarkable advantage in the toxicity study of TCM.
